Class LogUtilLog4J

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.logging.log4j.LogUtilLog4J
public final class LogUtilLog4J extends Object
A utility class for creating and managing Log4j appenders.

Rerouting logging to Log4J

  • JUL (java.util.logging): add log4j-jul to your dependencies and add a static initializer block before declaring any Logger: 
           static {
           System.setProperty("java.util.logging.manager", "org.apache.logging.log4j.jul.LogManager");
       }
  • SLF4J: add log4j-slf4j2-impl to your dependencies. Do not add any other logging implementation based on SLF4J (i.e., SimpleLogger, Logback).

  • Method Details

    • isDefaultImplementation

      public static boolean isDefaultImplementation()
      Check if the default dispatcher factory implementation is the Log4J implementation.
      Returns:
      true, if the Log4J implementation is used

    • translate

      public static LogLevel translate(org.apache.logging.log4j.Level level)
      Translates a Log4J Level object to a custom LogLevel object.

      This method takes a Log4J Level object as parameter and returns the corresponding custom LogLevel object. The translation is based on the integer level value of the Log4J Level object.

      Parameters:
      level - the Log4J Level object to be translated
      Returns:
      the custom LogLevel object that corresponds to the given Log4J Level object

    • translate

      public static org.apache.logging.log4j.Level translate(LogLevel level)
      Translates a LogLevel object to a Log4J Level object.

      This method takes a LogLevel Level object as parameter and returns the corresponding Log4J Level object.

      Parameters:
      level - the LogLevel object to be translated
      Returns:
      the Log4j Level object that corresponds to the given LogLevel object

    • init

      public static void init(LogLevel rootLevel)
      Configures the Log4J bridge implementations that are available.
      Parameters:
      rootLevel - the root level to set

    • updateLoggers

      public static void updateLoggers()
      Updates all loggers to add the global appender and refresh their configurations.

      This method retrieves the current LoggerContext from LogManager and iterates through all available loggers, adding the global appender to each logger. After updating the loggers with the global appender, it calls the updateLoggers method of the LoggerContext to apply the changes.

      This method ensures that all loggers in the application are configured with the globally defined appender, which might be necessary for consistent logging behavior across different parts of the application.

    • isClassOnClasspath

      public static boolean isClassOnClasspath(String className)
      Check if a class is on the classpath without loading it.
      Parameters:
      className - the fully qualified name of the class
      Returns:
      true, if the class is on the classpath
